column3: Based on suggestions from @laanwj and @dongcarl, the fallback HOST will be set to the output of `depends/config.guess`
What is this host define used for?\nCould this be auto-detected (if not explicitly set for cross-build) instead of assumed?
The host is passed down to depends and then used there to cross compile. Also, it is used to name the distdir folder.
So if you are not using depends, the host is only used to name the distdir folder.
So I am not sure if it makes sense to add auto-detect code to pick the right temporary name

It does look too much like "hardcoding an architecture" to me, which the point of this PR is to avoid. If it's only used to name a folder, can't we name it something architecture-independent? (like "native")\n(I'd dread to ever see ARM objects in a x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu directory and it not being a bug :smile: )\n
